Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2010 01:44PM Sharon03102010 wrote: Hello Ladies, as tomorrow starts the month of December, i would like to send prayers, well wishes and cyber hugs to all - may we all come thru with flying colors!  Reading through your posts i can see what amazingly kind and caring women you all are.  I truly wish they find a cure for this fast so no other person/family has to walk this path. I also wanted to pass this along (as hopefully it may work for someone else too):  when i awoke from my first mastectomy, it was really tough to get out of bed, but i discovered that by hooking my foot under the bed rail i could use that as leverage to help myself up and out of bed.  My surgery was delayed so i layed there with those fluid bag thingys for a long time - thus, i had to get in and out of bed constantly to go pee - it was freaky.  Sorry about the babbling. God Bless

Posts.Content: Dec 7, 2010 08:35PM - edited Aug 20, 2013 04:21AM by Sharon03102010 Mamanmidwife and Racemom, are your parachutes (bags) packed?  I'm keeping it simple, just packed my flannel pajamas for ride home, extra undie (just in case), socks, and banana bread that i baked today for the family to snack on while in the waiting room - i'm just being kept overnight at a surgery center; and the last time i didn't even bother brushing my hair or my teeth (LOL) - didn't really care at that point.  Oh, and don't forget your pillow for under the seatbelt strap for ride home (i'm 100 plus miles away).  I also, used Dove unscented sensitive skin soap. We're up next.  Like takeadeepbreath's awesome analogy let's "jump" and have soft landings.  Git R Done!  Praying for everyone.  Peace out.

Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2010 08:57AM Sharon03102010 wrote: Hello Ladies, Okay - here goes - having right (dominant side - wish i had a bidet lol) mastectomy with tissue expander on Dec 8th in St. Louis.  This will be my second one this year - i had a left mastectomy in March with exchange (gummy bear implant) and right side augmentation done in July (had to lift that saggy baggy boob).  During my nervous first year mammogram in Oct they found calcs in other breast that needle biopsy showed to be atypical - talk about bad de ja vu.  Skipping lumpectomy this time and going straight for mastectomy.  Hindsight is 20/20. This might be tmi but i recommend buying stool softener, cause for me the constipation after surgery was a close tie for the worse part of the whole ordeal lol.  Baby wipes are good too for a refreshing wipe down - as i showered every other day in the beginning.  Sleeping in a recliner was easiest for me for first 2-3 weeks.  Also, if your brain is like mine, it helped me to keep a journal - or i wouldn't have been able to remember the whens and details of it all. Thank you Zogo for starting this thread and for letting me vent and share - somehow it's cathartic to see it in writing on this invaluable website.  I know it's tough to get into the holiday spirit with this looming over our heads, but i want to wish everyone Happy Thanksgiving and send strength and courage your way - we are stronger than we know.

Posts.Content: Dec 15, 2010 12:13PM Sharon03102010 wrote: Hi gals, as u may have noticed i'm more of a reader than poster, but wanted to say that i'm so thrilled for the jumpers who had no unexpected complications; and that i am truly bummed out for those who had unexpected stuff (to put it nicely) show up on path or other sort of sh_tty news that prolongs this rollercoaster ride from hell (sorry, hope not to offend); it really hurts. So far i have been fortunate that my pain/discomfort this time has been significantly less than last time (about 90%) - i guess due to no node removal (the difference in pain is unbelieveable) and muscle already being stretched from augmentation last july - can't really feel expander, and no drain hole burning pain - got lucky there.  No funky hairy forest going on this time in my armpit (last time so sore couldn't wash or shave there for a while) and the stool softener eliminated another torture.  Just wanted to share that for those who are not removing nodes or had breast augmentation prior; although i do realize that everyone still reacts differently.  Will have first follow up appt with my surgeon on Fri to go over everything; nurse called the next day and said everything looked good - was still foggy and i'm almost sure that's what she said. Anyhoo, i also wanted to pass this utube video www.KomenPhiladelphia.org/Video that my aunt emailed me about - as everytime someone watches it a donation is made.  It brought tears to my eyes, but in a good way!  Again, prayers and peace and comfort to all.  Remember the reason for the season; God Bless.  Love, S

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2010 10:39AM - edited Aug 20, 2013 04:12AM by Sharon03102010 Thank you Zogo for the calendar dates - you are so good.  Megan, sorry that your surgery is on your birthday.  I am phyced for your upcoming fun dates.  My mom had BC too; idc, bmx w/o recon 18 yrs ago; i also find in hard to talk to her about it.  I moved from hawaii to missouri (thank goodness for good in-laws) - funny as old as i am i still want my parents here with me, but they're getting up there in age and my dad as early alzhiemers.  You know that rolling stone's song "You can't always get what you want" LOL.  Laurie, my drs wouldn't advise me what to do, but i read between the lines when my surgeon's reply was BC is serious - that sealed the deal for me.  Gee, i thought the chance of BC after mastectomy was 2 percent - sure hope it's not as high as 10 - we need all the odds in our favor as we can get.  Anetnut, praying for good test results; it always hurts me to see a profile in a higher stage than mine.  Don't know how you feel about taking drugs (i'm from the school of thought - bring on the drugs), but i was a walking zombie until my dr prescribed me valium a few weeks out from surgery and it totally helped with my sleep - like Megan said we are strong, but human too.  Pink13, glad Mayo put your concerns to rest.  Gigi, how's that pina colada tasting? Big hugs
